faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.description: Common questions about our image cropping tool

free.question: Is this image cropper completely free?
free.answer: Yes, our image cropping tool is 100% free with no hidden costs, watermarks, or registration requirements. You can crop unlimited images without any restrictions.

formats.question: What image formats are supported?
formats.answer: We support all common image formats including JPEG, PNG, WebP, GIF, BMP, and TIFF. You can export your cropped images in PNG, JPEG, or WebP formats.

fileSize.question: What's the maximum file size I can upload?
fileSize.answer: You can upload images up to 10MB in size. This supports high-resolution photos and most professional image files while ensuring fast processing.

privacy.question: Are my images stored on your servers?
privacy.answer: No, all image processing happens locally in your browser. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, ensuring complete privacy and security.

mobile.question: Can I crop images on mobile devices?
mobile.answer: Absolutely! Our tool is fully optimized for mobile devices with touch-friendly controls. You can crop images on phones and tablets just as easily as on desktop.

quality.question: How do I maintain image quality when cropping?
quality.answer: Use the 'Best Quality' download option for maximum resolution. You can also adjust the quality setting (70-100%) to balance file size and image quality based on your needs.

undo.question: Can I undo changes while cropping?
undo.answer: Yes, you can reset individual adjustments or use the 'Reset All' button to start over. The tool also provides real-time preview so you can see changes before applying them.

aspectRatios.question: What aspect ratios are available?
aspectRatios.answer: We offer common ratios like Square (1:1), Portrait (3:4), Landscape (4:3), Wide (16:9), and Free Crop mode for custom dimensions.

square.description: Perfect for profile photos and avatars

wide.description: Widescreen format for banners and covers

upload.title: Upload & Choose Preset
upload.description: Upload your image by clicking "Upload" or drag & drop. Select a compression preset: High Quality (minimal compression), Balanced (good ratio), Small Size (maximum compression), or Web Optimized.

customize.title: Customize & Preview

emailMessaging.description: Reduce image sizes for email attachments and messaging apps. Share photos quickly without exceeding attachment limits.

storageOptimization.title: Storage Optimization
storageOptimization.description: Save storage space on devices and cloud services. Compress photo libraries and archives while preserving visual quality.

mobileApp.title: Mobile App Development
mobileApp.description: Optimize images for mobile apps to reduce app size and improve performance. Essential for app store submissions and user experience.

websiteSpeed.title: Improve Website Speed
websiteSpeed.description: Smaller images load faster, improving user experience and SEO rankings. Essential for modern web performance and mobile optimization.

saveStorage.title: Save Storage Space
saveStorage.description: Reduce storage costs and free up space on devices, servers, and cloud services. Perfect for managing large photo collections.

betterUX.title: Better User Experience
betterUX.description: Faster loading images improve engagement and reduce bounce rates. Critical for e-commerce, portfolios, and content-heavy websites.

advancedTech.title: Advanced Technology
advancedTech.description: State-of-the-art compression algorithms that preserve quality while achieving maximum size reduction. Professional results every time.

completePrivacy.title: Complete Privacy
completePrivacy.description: Images are processed locally in your browser. No server uploads, no data collection, and complete privacy protection for sensitive images.

noLimitations.title: No Limitations
noLimitations.description: Completely free with no watermarks, file limits, or registration requirements. Compress unlimited images with full access to all features.

free.question: Is this image compressor completely free?
free.answer: Yes, our image compression tool is 100% free with no hidden costs, watermarks, or registration requirements. You can compress unlimited images without any restrictions.

fileSizeReduction.question: How much can I reduce my image file size?
fileSizeReduction.answer: Depending on the image and settings, you can typically reduce file sizes by 50-90% while maintaining good visual quality. Our smart compression algorithms optimize each image for the best results.

supportedFormats.question: What image formats are supported?
supportedFormats.answer: We support JPEG, PNG, WebP, and other common formats for input. You can export compressed images in JPEG, PNG, or WebP formats for optimal web compatibility.

qualityImpact.question: Will compressing affect image quality?
qualityImpact.answer: Our advanced algorithms are designed to minimize quality loss. The High Quality preset maintains near-original quality, while other presets offer good visual quality with smaller file sizes.

maxFileSize.question: What's the maximum file size I can compress?
maxFileSize.answer: You can upload images up to 50MB in size. This supports high-resolution photos and professional image files while ensuring fast processing speeds.

privacy.question: Are my images stored on your servers?
privacy.answer: No, all compression happens locally in your browser. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, ensuring complete privacy and security for your photos.

mobile.question: Can I compress images on mobile devices?
mobile.answer: Absolutely! Our tool is fully optimized for mobile devices with touch-friendly controls. You can compress images on phones and tablets just as easily as on desktop.

presets.question: What's the difference between compression presets?
presets.answer: High Quality (minimal compression), Balanced (good size/quality ratio), Small Size (maximum compression), Web Optimized (perfect for websites), and Custom (full control over settings).

emailSharing.title: Email & Sharing
emailSharing.description: Reduce image size for email attachments or faster sharing while maintaining visual quality. Perfect for quick file size reduction.

supportedFormats.question: What image formats are supported for resizing?
supportedFormats.answer: Our image resizer supports JPEG, PNG, and WebP formats. You can upload files up to 50MB in size and convert between different formats during the resize process.

qualityImpact.question: Will resizing affect image quality?
qualityImpact.answer: When enlarging images, some quality loss is inevitable due to interpolation. When reducing size, quality is generally well-preserved. We use advanced algorithms to minimize quality degradation during resizing.

aspectRatio.question: Can I maintain the aspect ratio while resizing?
aspectRatio.answer: Yes! You can choose to maintain the original aspect ratio (proportional resize) or stretch the image to exact dimensions. The aspect ratio lock helps prevent distortion.

resizeMethods.question: What resize methods are available?
resizeMethods.answer: You can resize by percentage (e.g., 50% of original), exact pixel dimensions, or choose from preset sizes for common use cases like thumbnails, social media, or print formats.

imageSizeLimit.question: Is there a limit on image size?
imageSizeLimit.answer: You can upload images up to 50MB. The maximum output dimensions depend on your browser's capabilities, but typically support very large images up to 10,000x10,000 pixels.

batchResize.question: Can I batch resize multiple images?
batchResize.answer: Currently, the tool processes one image at a time. For multiple images, you'll need to resize them individually. We're considering batch processing for future updates.

privacy.question: Are my images uploaded to a server?
privacy.answer: No, all image processing happens locally in your browser. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, ensuring complete privacy and faster processing.

undoResize.question: Can I undo a resize operation?
undoResize.answer: You can use the reset function to clear the current session and start over with the original image. However, once you download a resized image, you'll need the original to make further changes.
